channel.title: math.QA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.QA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Derivations and Hochschild cohomology of quantum nilpotent algebras
item.description: arXiv:2505.06205v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We compute the derivations of Quantum Nilpotent Algebras under a technical (but necessary) assumption on the center. As a consequence, we give an explicit description of the first Hochschild cohomology group of $U_q^+(\mathfrak{g})$, the positive part of the quantized enveloping algebra of a finite-dimensional complex simple Lie algebra $\mathfrak{g}$. Our results are obtained leveraging an initial cluster constructed by Goodearl and Yakimov.
item.dc:creator: St\'ephane Launois, Samuel A. Lopes, Isaac Oppong

item.title: Knot-quiver correspondence: a brief review
item.description: arXiv:2505.05668v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This note is an overview of the knot-quiver correspondence, which relates symmetric quivers and their partition functions, a.k.a. motivic Donaldson-Thomas generating series, to quantum invariants of knots and links in $S^3$.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Kucharski, Dmitry Noshchenko

item.title: Representation gaps of rigid planar diagram monoids
item.description: arXiv:2505.05846v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We define non-pivotal analogs of the Temperley-Lieb, Motzkin, and planar rook monoids, and compute bounds for the sizes of their nontrivial simple representations. From this, we assess the two types of monoids in their relative suitability for use in cryptography by comparing their representation gaps and gap ratios. We conclude that the non-pivotal monoids are generally worse for cryptographic purposes.
item.dc:creator: Willow Stewart, Daniel Tubbenhauer
